Server: Apache/2
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html

﻿<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">

    </style>    <title>XNA GPA - XNA 4.0 RPG Tutorials</title>
    <meta name="description" content="Page dedicated to my XNA 4.0 RPG tutorials on creating a role playing game" />
</head>
<body>
<div id="wrapper"> <!-- wrapper start -->
﻿    <div id="header"> <!-- header start -->
        <a href="index.php"><img id="headerlink" src="Images/xnagpalogo.png" alt="Xna Game Programming adventures" /></a>
    </div> <!-- header end -->
    <div id="hmenu"> <!-- menu start -->
        <ul>
            <li><a href="index.php">Home</a></li>
            <li><a href="news.php">News</a></li>
            <li><a href="http://xnagpa.net/forum/index.php" target="_blank">Forum</a></li>
            <li><a href="tutorials.php">Tutorials</a></li>
            <li><a href="xna4tutorials.php">4.0 Tutorials</a></li>
            <li><a href="xnasites.php">Links</a></li>
            <li><a href="about.php">About</a></li>
        </ul>    </div> <!-- menu end -->    <div id="mainarea"> <!-- main area start -->
        <div id="contentarea"> 
            <h1>XNA Game Programming Adventures<br />XNA 4.0 RPG Tutorials</h1>
            This page is for my XNA 4.0 RPG Tutorials series. On this page you will find the tutorials in PDF format as
            well as the project at the end of each tutorial. Starting with tutorial 14 I will be including the data I 
            create during the tutorials in a ZIP file as well.<br /><br />
            If you find an error in a tutorial, have a request for future tutorials in the series, you can post them on 
            my forum. If you are posting errors please give the class and region the error is in. This will make it much 
            easier for me to find the problem.<br /><br />
            <strong>Part 1 - Getting Stated</strong><br />
            This first tutoiral is about getting started with the role playing game, Eyes of the Dragon. I create the 
            basic project, two class libraries, and some components that will be used through out the rest of the 
            tutorials.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial1.pdf" target="_blank">Part 1 - Getting Started</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon1.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 2 - More Core Components</strong><br />
            In the second tutorial I add in support for Xbox 360 controllers to the input handler. I also add in some  
            GUI controls and a class to manage them. I add in another screen to the game and show how to move between 
            game states.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial2.pdf" target="_blank">Part 2 - More Core Components</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon2.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 3 - Even More Core Components</strong><br />
            In this third tutorial I added in a new GUI control, a PictureBox. I also added in another game screen, the playing 
            screen. I also filled out the starting menu screen.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial3.pdf" target="_blank">Part 3 - Even More Core Components</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon3.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 4 - Tile Engine</strong><br />
            The forth tutorial is about adding in a tile engine for the game. The tile engine is what you will use to draw the 
            maps the player will use to explore your world. In the next tutorial I will add in more to the tile engine.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial4.pdf" target="_blank">Part 4 - Tile Engine</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon4.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 5 - Tile Engine Part 2</strong><br />
            I continued on with the tile engine in this tutorial. It includes adding in a 2D camera to control scrolling the 
            map and having maps with multiple layers and multiple tile sets.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial5.pdf" target="_blank">Part 5 - Tile Engine Part 2</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon5.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 6 - Character Generator</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers adding a new control to be used with the control manager and adding in a screen for the player to 
            create their character.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial6.pdf" target="_blank">Part 6 - Character Generator</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon6.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 7 - Animated Sprite</strong><br />
            In this tutorial I added in an animated sprite for the player to control. I also added two modes for the camera. In 
            the one mode the camera follows the sprite and in the other the camera moves independently of the sprite.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial7.pdf" target="_blank">Part 7 - Animated Sprite</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon7.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 8 - Character Generator and Tile Engine</strong><br />
            This tutorial improves the character generator by showing a preview of the player's character selection. I also added 
            in zooming in and out to the tile engine as well as using a transformation matrix in the drawing code so you no longer 
            always need to subtract the camera's position.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial8.pdf" target="_blank">Part 8 - Character Generator and Tile Engine</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon8.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 9 - Item Classes</strong><br />
            This adds in some basic classes for items in the game and a class to manage them. The class for managing them isn't 
            meant for invenroty, that will be added later on down the road.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial9.pdf" target="_blank">Part 9 - Item Classes</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon9.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 10 - Character Classes</strong><br />
            This adds in some basic classes for characters in the game and a class to represent the world the game takes 
            place in. <br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial10.pdf" target="_blank">Part 10 - Character Classes</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon10.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 11A - Game Editor</strong><br />
            In this tutorial I add in an editor for the game and move from a static character class system to a dynamic character 
            class system. This is part one of a three part tutorial.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial11a.pdf" target="_blank">Part 11A - Game Editor</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon11A.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 11B - Game Editor</strong><br />
            In this second part of tutorial 11. In this tutorial I continue on with adding in editors for the game.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial11b.pdf" target="_blank">Part 11B - Game Editor</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon11B.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 11C - Game Editor</strong><br />
            In this third part of tutorial 11. In this tutorial I continue on with adding in editors for the game.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial11c.pdf" target="_blank">Part 11C - Game Editor</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon11C.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 12 - Updating Game</strong><br />
            This tutorial upgrades a few things in the game. I expand on the World class and make the tile engine a little more 
            efficient.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial12.pdf" target="_blank">Part 12 - Updating Game</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon12.zip">Project</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 13 - List Box and Load Game Screen</strong><br />
            I cover adding in a List Box control and adding in a new screen to load games from. I also updated a couple screens 
            to make it easier to load games and start new games.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial13.pdf" target="_blank">Part 13 - List Box and Load Game Screen</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon13.zip">Project</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 14A & 14B - More Game Editors</strong><br />
            In this 2 part tutorial I do a little work on the editors and actual create some data that can be read into our 
            game.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial14a.pdf" target="_blank">Part 14A - Game Editor</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial14b.pdf" target="_blank">Part 14B - Game Editor</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon14A.zip">Project - 14A</a><br />            
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon14B.zip">Project - 14B</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/gamedata14.zip">Game Data</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 15 - Skills, Spells, and Talents</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers adding in some basic classes that will be needed down the road for skills, spells, and 
            talents.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial15.pdf" target="_blank">Part 15 - Skills, Spells, and Talents</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon15.zip">Project</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 16 - Quests and Conversations</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers adding in some basic classes that will be needed down the road for conversations and quests. It 
            also updates the game to use the classes from the past two tutorials.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial16.pdf" target="_blank">Part 16 - Quests and Conversations</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon16.zip">Project</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 17 - Finding Loot</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers the basics of placing chests for the player to interact with. They are just being drawn at the 
            moment but picking them up will come eventually. I also added in a couple place holder classes for traps.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial17.pdf" target="_blank">Part 17 - Finding Loot</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon17.zip">Project</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 18A & 18B - Finding Loot Part 2</strong><br />
            In this 2 part tutorial I do a little work on the the player being able to find loot. I added chests and keys to the 
            game editor and read in a chest at run time!<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial18a.pdf" target="_blank">Part 18A - Finding Loot Part 2</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial18b.pdf" target="_blank">Part 18B - Finding Loot Part 2</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon18.zip">Project - 18</a><br />            
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/gamedata18.zip">Game Data</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 19 - Skills Continued</strong><br />
            This tutorial expands on skills and adding skills to the editor. Soon I will cover reading in skills at run time and 
            assigning points to skills.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial19.pdf" target="_blank">Part 19 - Skills Continued</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon19.zip">Project</a><br />            
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/gamedata19.zip">Game Data</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 20 - More On Skills</strong><br />
            I add a new control to the game and a screen for distributing skill points.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial20.pdf" target="_blank">Part 20 - Skills Continued</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon20.zip">Project</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 21 - Basic Inventory</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers the basics of inventory in the game opposed to the data we have been working with up to now.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial21.pdf" target="_blank">Part 21 - Basic Inventory</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon21.zip">Project</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 22 - Reading Data</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers reading in the data made in the editor and updating the Player class.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial22.pdf" target="_blank">Part 22 - Reading Data</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon22.zip">Project</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 23 - Level Editor</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers creating a basic level editor that you can create levels and draw the map.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial23A.pdf" target="_blank">Part 23A - Level Editor</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial23B.pdf" target="_blank">Part 23B - Level Editor</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon23.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 24 - Level Editor Part 2</strong><br />
            I continue on with the level editor in this tutorial adding in some nice enhancements and being able to 
            write out and read in levels.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial24.pdf" target="_blank">Part 24 - Level Editor Part 2</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon24.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 25 - Level Editor Part 3</strong><br />
            I continue on with the level editor in this tutorial adding in some more features and making the drawing a little 
            more responsive.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial25.pdf" target="_blank">Part 25 - Level Editor Part 3</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon25.zip">Project</a><br /><br />            
            <strong>Part 26 - More on Skills</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers adding in more about skills to the game. I also updated the game state manager to have a short 
            transition time between screens.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial26.pdf" target="_blank">Part 26 - More On Skills</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon26.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 27 - Updates and More on Talents</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers adding in more about taletns to the game and updating a few componets.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial27.pdf" target="_blank">Part 27 - Updates and More on Talents</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon27.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 28 - More on Spells and Effects</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers adding in more about taletns to the game and updating a few componets.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial28.pdf" target="_blank">Part 28 - More on Spells and Effects</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon28.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 29 - Weaknesses and Resistances</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers adding in weakness and resistances to damage effecgts.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial29.pdf" target="_blank">Part 29 - Weaknesses and Resistances</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon29.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 30 - Updating Weapons</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers updating weapons to use damage effects.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial30.pdf" target="_blank">Part 30 - Updating Weapons</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon30.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            <strong>Part 31 - Tile Engine Update</strong><br />
            This tutorial covers making an update to the tile engine.<br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/rpgtutorials/xna4rpgtutorial31.pdf" target="_blank">Part 31 - Tile Engine Update</a><br />
            <a href="http://xnagpa.net/xna4/downloads/EyesOfTheDragon31.zip">Project</a><br /><br />
            Good luck with your XNA game programming adventures.<br />        
            <br />
            Jamie McMahon<br />
            <br />            
        </div><!-- content area end -->
